title: ASL 9.7 ‚Äî Planning an Event: Roles, Supplies, Deadlines üóìÔ∏è
objectives: Assign roles and responsibilities using clear indexing and listing
Request/confirm supplies with quantity and due time
Use Time ‚Üí Topic ‚Üí Comment for planning updates

vocab.def: Flat hand taps shoulder; assign role.
Non-dominant hand as list; index each item with 1-2-3.
Time constraint marker with firm NMM.

sections.heading: 1) Roles with a List Hand
sections.body: Use your non-dominant hand as a vertical **LIST (1‚Äì3‚Äì4)**. Assign: **RESPONSIBLE WHO?** Then touch each slot to anchor the role.

sections.heading: 2) Supplies: Quantity + Type
sections.body: Use number first plus classifier: **WATER 6 BOTTLE**, **PLATE 30 (CL:flat-stack)**. Keep each item to one concise line.

sections.heading: 3) Deadlines with Time ‚Üí Topic ‚Üí Comment
sections.body: Frame updates as **TIME ‚Üí TOPIC ‚Üí COMMENT**: **FRIDAY ‚Üí DECORATION ‚Üí YOU BRING BALLOON 20, DUE 4PM.**

sections.heading: 4) Partner Planner
sections.body: A is coordinator; B is volunteer. A assigns **two roles** and **two supply items** with deadlines. B **repeat-backs** to confirm. Swap roles.
sections.teacherNote: Listen for number-first, clear list anchoring, and explicit DUE markers.

sections.heading: 5) Mini-Board
sections.body: Sketch a quick 1‚Äì4 list on air: **1 FOOD, 2 DECOR, 3 SIGN-IN, 4 CLEAN-UP**. Point to an item and give a Time ‚Üí Topic ‚Üí Comment update.

items.q: Which order is clearest for planning updates?

options: Air list with 1‚Äì2‚Äì3 and index each

items.q: Gloss an assignment: 'Saturday 2PM ‚Üí Sign-in table ‚Üí You responsible. Need 2 clipboards, 10 pens, due by 1:30PM.'

items.prompt: Which is hardest‚Äîanchoring a list, number-first quantities, or DUE timing? Plan one fix.

reflectionPrompt: Record 25‚Äì35s assigning two roles and two supply items with clear deadlines. Include a repeat-back confirmation.
summary: You assigned roles using a list hand, gave supply quantities with classifiers, and framed updates in Time ‚Üí Topic ‚Üí Comment with explicit deadlines.
